member.name: IPerChannelDbLevel.GetLevelRange
member.summary: The GetLevelRange method gets the range, in decibels, of the volume level of the specified channel.
member.param: The number of the selected channel. If the audio stream has n channels, the channels are numbered from 0 to n– 1. To get the number of channels in the stream, call the method.
Pointer to a float variable into which the method writes the minimum volume level in decibels.
Pointer to a float variable into which the method writes the maximum volume level in decibels.

Pointer to a float variable into which the method writes the stepping value between consecutive volume levels in the range *pfMinLevelDB to *pfMaxLevelDB. If the difference between the maximum and minimum volume levels is d decibels, and the range is divided into n steps (uniformly sized intervals), then the volume can have n + 1 discrete levels and the size of the step between consecutive levels is d / n decibels.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns S_OK. If it fails, possible return codes include, but are not limited to, the values shown in the following table.

listheader.description: Parameter nChannel is out of range.
Pointer pfminLevelDB, pfmaxLevelDB, or pfmaxLevelDB is NULL.

member.name: IPerChannelDbLevel.SetLevelAllChannels
member.summary: The SetLevelAllChannels method sets the volume levels, in decibels, of all the channels in the audio stream.
member.param: Pointer to an array of volume levels. This parameter points to a caller-allocated float array into which the method writes the new volume levels, in decibels, for all the channels. The method writes the level for a particular channel into the array element whose index matches the channel number. If the audio stream contains n channels, the channels are numbered 0 to n– 1. To get the number of channels in the stream, call the method.
The number of elements in the aLevelsDB array. If this parameter does not match the number of channels in the audio stream, the method fails without modifying the aLevelsDB array.

Context value for the method. This parameter points to an event-context GUID. If the SetLevelAllChannels call changes the state of the level control, all clients that have registered interfaces with that control receive notifications. In its implementation of the OnNotify method, a client can inspect the event-context GUID to discover whether it or another client is the source of the control-change event. If the caller supplies a NULL pointer for this parameter, the client's notification method receives a NULL context pointer.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns S_OK. If it fails, possible return codes include, but are not limited to, the values shown in the following table.

listheader.description: Parameter cChannels does not equal the number of channels.

summary.para: The IPerChannelDbLevel interface represents a generic subunit control interface that provides per-channel control over the volume level, in decibels, of an audio stream or of a frequency band in an audio stream. A positive volume level represents gain, and a negative value represents attenuation.
